listing.description: The accommodation, that extends to in excess of 1,050 sq ft, comprises entrance hall with doors leading to: Through reception room opening to kitchen/breakfast room with French doors to rear garden and further reception/family room with guest WC and utility room. The first floor comprises master bedroom with walk in wardrobe to front aspect, two further double bedrooms and recently refurbished family bathroom suite. The property is presented in good decorative order throughout and retains many period features to include sash windows, stripped wood floors, cast iron fireplaces with slate hearths and stripped panel doors. These period details are well twinned with modern contemporary styling to include contemporary kitchen and bathroom suites, exposed brickwork and a landscaped decked town garden with mature planted borders.Chase Side Place is an attractive period terrace recessed back from Chase Side, close to its junction to Chase Green Avenue, and the immediate vicinity contains several attractive period properties making it one of Enfields most desirable enclaves. The property is particularly well positioned for easy access to Enfield Town with its many and varied shopping and leisure amenities. Enfield Chase Station (Overground) is within comfortable walking distance and provides regular commuter services to Londons principal Stations. Of particular note are the many schools of good renown situated close by to include St George's Roman Catholic and St Andrews C of E Primary Schools and Chase Community School.
listing.short_description: A very well presented/desirable three bedroom, two/three reception room period family home (circa 1890), located upon Chase Side Place, thus well placed for access to Enfields surrounding amenities.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: A Grade II listed detached house built around the 15th Century with further extensions/changes added at a later date and in need of complete refurbishment throughout. There is the possibility to obtain consents for both the repair/upgrading of this timber framed property and planning permission for development in the garden subject to strict guidelines by the English Heritage Society and Hillingdon Borough Council.Eldar Farm is a very unique medieval farmhouse and rarely comes to the market having been within the current vendor’s family for well over 150 years. In its original form the house would have been rendered white rather than the current pebbledash exterior, the walls are constructed from a technique called Wattle and Daub and boasts the original flagstone flooring. With an abundance of character the current layout of the Farm House comprises of an entrance lobby leading to a utility area and sitting room, inner hallway, kitchen, bathroom, dining room and a front living room all located on the ground floor level. To the first there are four double bedrooms and an inner lobby with the total floor space measuring nearly 1400 sq ft. Other benefits include approximately half an acre of gardens and an orchard with a number of mature fruit trees as well as ample off street parking.Located to the north of Heathrow Airport and within half a mile of the main Bath Road, the property sit’s at the far end of West End Lane which is a mainly residential road with a mixture of modern and older style houses as well as maisonettes. There are three main bus routes that service the property which are the 140, H98 and 90 providing access to Hounslow, Hayes and Northolt. Hayes and Harlington mainline station is less than 2 miles from the property and will greatly benefit from the Crossrail link in late 2018/19 which will link the area to East London by a 30 minute train journey. There are several schools in the local area as well as open parkland, convenience stores and public houses. The M4 is easily accessible and provides links to the M25 as well as a direct route into Central London. EPC Rating: FFurther details are available in the office upon request, viewings are recommended to appreciate the full potential of the property and site.

listing.letting_fees:
Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Once you have found a property and your offer has been accepted by the landlord, we will require a Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Between £500.00-£1,000.00 (depending on the value of the property), deducted from your final completion monies.
Standard Fees
Administration fees
We handle all the paperwork and provide a tenancy agreement for you and your landlord to sign. The fee is based on the size of the property, the number of tenants and rental value:
• Up to £1,500.00 pcm:£600.00 per tenancy
• Up to £2,00.000 pcm: £660.00 per tenancy
• Over £2,000.00 pcm: £poa per tenancy
References
Includes an employer’s reference to confirm your income to rent ratio for affordability, a credit history check, confirmation of residency and a previous landlord’s reference (if applicable).
• £60.00 per person

Initial Move in Monies
All the initial move in monies and will need to be paid in cleared funds to us 3 days prior to move in.
Security Deposit
The deposit will be protected as part of the tenancy deposit regulations; we use the industry renowned my|deposits. 6 weeks rent prior to moving into the property, this will be refunded to you at the end of the tenancy minus any deductions, if applicable.
Inventory Check In procedure
A convenient time will be arranged for you to meet with the inventory clerk to formally check you into the property. Prices vary according to the size of the property.
• Studio: £125.00
• 1 Bedroom: £145.00
• 2 Bedrooms: £155.00
• 3 Bedrooms: £175.00
• 4 Bedrooms: £190.00
• 5 Bedrooms: £210.00

Other fees that may apply
Express Administration
Within 5 working days or less
• £120.00
Abortive appointment
In the event that an appointment has been booked with you and you fail to be present at the agreed times without prior notification to us.
• £85.00
Renewing a tenancy
• £120.00 administration fee per tenancy
Credit check at renewal
In some circumstances, it may be a pre agreed requirement for a new credit check to be obtained at the point of renewal.
• £60.00 per person
Landlord references
If you decide to move on and require for us to provide you with a reference to your new agent or landlord.
• £30.00
Tenancy Swap Fees
Administration: Covering contract negotiation, amending terms, updating the tenancy agreement during the tenancy and immigration and visa confirmation.
• £300.00 per tenancy
Referencing: Referencing the new occupant, including identity, financial credit checks, obtaining references from current or previous employers / landlords and any other relevant information to assess affordability
• £60 per tenancy
Note: All prices quoted are inclusive of VAT at 20%.

If you have any questions regarding our fees please feel free to ask a member of staff.

listing.description: A spectacular recently refurbished house with a private garden and residents' parking on a quiet residential road on the border of Brentford and South Ealing. The property features solid oak doors, LED spot-lighting and brand-new carpets throughout, in addition to a brand-new slate roof and a new boiler.The ground floor of the house itself consists of a designer fully fitted kitchen, attached dining area with bi-folding doors leading out into a generous newly-returfed private garden with charcoal-stained decking, additional living room with wooden flooring, and a brand new downstairs bathroom. The first floor hosts a second brand new bathroom with high-quality fittings, and three double bedrooms, with a fourth double bedroom located on the lower ground floor. Two of the bedrooms and the dining area feature electric skylights with automatic sensors which provide the property with outstanding natural light.Orchard Road is one of Brentford's best connected locations, providing commuters with easy access to Brentford Mainline and Boston Manor Underground stations, as well as the A4/M4 and local bus routes - all of which provide excellent transport links both into and out of the city centre. Brentford town centre and Northfield Avenue close by offer a selection of shops, cafes and restaurants, while families benefit from proximity to nearby schools including Brentford School for Girls and Gunnersbury Catholic School.

listing.description: Four bedroom semi-detached, located in quiet residential location, Potters Bar High Street is a short walk away. The property has been thoughtfully extended, an ideal family home.A spacious hallway leads you to the kitchen, which has been recently refurbished. Also, off the hall is the light and airy lounge, with marble fireplace. Double doors take you into the dining room, plus a downstairs cloakroom. Upstairs there are four bedrooms, with the master possessing an en-suite shower room. Fitted wardrobes can be found in two of the bedrooms, with further fitted wardrobes in the passageway leading to bedroom four. In addition there is a family bathroom.The property also offers a large loft space which, subject to planning, would provide further accommodation.The garden is south facing, with patio area and lawn. As well as the garage there is additional parking on the driveway.Potters Bar High Street is very close by and the second shopping area, Darkes Lane, offers further amenities plus Potters Bar Railway Station (16 minutes to London, Kings Cross). Also, the M25 & A1M are also close by.Potters Bar has private schooling locally, Stormont for girls, is very close and Lochinver House for boys is also in the town. The renowned Dame Alice Owen school is situated in Potters Bar.

listing.letting_fees:
Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.

listing.description: Located in one of the most prestigious areas of London on the sought after Cheyne Walk Moorings, a contemporary 3 double bedroom houseboat is crafted within a steel hull. This houseboat boasts an ample amount of living space, split over 2 levels and also has a generous amount of further deck space which makes a great entertaining space and allows for unparalleled views of both the river and across London’s city skyline. The upper deck of the houseboat boasts a unique and large reception room which leads onto the South facing fore-end deck. The lower deck has a newly refurbished modern kitchen come dining area, the spacious master bedroom, a further two smaller bedrooms, the family bathroom and an abundance of storage in the fore-end. The current layout of the lower deck is such that it allows for significant alteration to the space to be made if required. The Cheyne Walk Moorings situated in Chelsea close to Battersea Bridge and walking distance to the ever-popular Kings Road and all the amenities and boutique shops it has to offer. The beautiful Battersea Park is also a short walk over the bridge. Licence and Mooring information: We have been informed that the houseboat currently possesses a Residential Licence for it’s mooring space, this is valid for approximately a further 2 years. Maintenance fees: We have been informed by that the fees are approximately £16,000pa which includes certain utilities (subject to confirmation).
listing.short_description: Located in prime Chelsea on the coveted Cheyne Walk Moorings, this bright and spacious 3 bedroom houseboat is situated within a steel hull and offers a vast amount of accommodation over 2 levels and a wealth of deck space from which to admire the Thames and London skyline.

listing.letting_fees:
New Assured Shorthold Tenancies (ast’s) signed on or after 1st June 2019

The following charges are payable or potentially payable by a tenant:
Holding deposit - A maximum of one week’s rent
Security deposit - Five weeks’ rent, rising to six week’s rent when the annual rent is in excess of £50,000
Rent and Utility bills - Payable as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Unpaid rent - Interest at 3% above the Bank of England base rate, as outlined in the Tenancy Agreement
Lost Keys - Tenants are liable for the cost of replacing any lost keys or security device, including a change of lock or replacement of device if required
Amendments of Tenancy Agreement at Tenant’s Request - £50 per change
Early Surrender of the ast at Tenant’s Request - Should a tenant need to surrender the tenancy early and the Landlord agrees to re-let the property, the liability for the payment of rent will end once a new tenant is found and takes up occupation. However, the tenant will still need to cover the Landlord’s costs in surrendering the tenancy and re-letting the property

Non ast’s signed on or after 1st June 2019

For any individual tenant not renting a property under an Assured Shorthold Tenancy the following charges are also payable:
Tenancy Administration charge - £180 per tenancy
Reference charge - £60 per tenant or guarantor
Check-in charge - £144 per tenancy
Renewal charge - £144 per renewal

If a tenant decides to rent a property through us in the name of a business or company the tenancy administration and reference charge will be £480 for a new tenancy and £240 for every renewal.

All prices are inclusive of VAT.

As a member of The Property Ombudsman (tpo) for sales and lettings we subscribe to tpo’s Codes of Practice. This Government approved independent redress scheme gives consumers additional protection beyond that required by law. Our clients have peace of mind that there is free and fair redress available in the unlikely event of an unresolved dispute involving our agency.

As regulated members of ARLA and RICS this means that any monies we hold is insured. ​​This gives our clients peace of mind and financial protection that their money will always be safe in our hands under the RICS Client Money Protection Scheme.

listing.description: This 4 bedroom property offers everything for modern day living. The owners have refurbished the entire property over the past 12 months. It's ideally located with the A2/A20/M25 motorway network only minutes away and less than 5 minutes from Bexley, Albany Park and Sidcup mainline train stations. It's also ideally located for the nearby, highly regarded Primary, Secondary and Grammar Schools in close proximity.Originally built in the 1930's it was one of the original show homes and has features not found in other properties on the same round, including dual aspect bedrooms and living room with bay windows. It has been extended to offer a great living space with an open plan kitchen/diner, together with a utility room, additional bathroom facilities and a beautifully appointed master bedroom with ensuite.Once inside you are presented with a spacious lounge to the front. To the rear the second reception room extends into a combined kitchen/dining area providing a bright and spacious social area. Additionally there is a purpose built utility room with washer/dryer and sink, a new downstairs w.C. And ample storage.There are three double bedrooms on the 1st floor, 2 of which are generous in terms of space with one featuring 3, double, built-in wardrobes. The modern bathroom features a double shower and free-standing bath and has been finished to a very high standard.The landing has additional storage and a further staircase leading the master bedroom and en suite which has been cleverly designed to match the features of the original house, encompassing black wooden beams. The room is light and spacious with a modern ensuite and built in Velux window.The 100ft, mature garden offers a pond, 2 sheds with concrete bases and a purpose build annexe, offering 2 rooms as per the floor plan which, subject to approval, could easily be converted into detached annexe which is well constructed and offers substantial loft space for storage and full electrics.Lounge3.69m x 3.64m (12'1" x 11'11")Dining Room4.38m x 3.47m (14'4" x 11'5")Kitchen5.64m x 5.17m (18'6" x 17'0")Master Bedroom4.01m x 3.75m (13'2" x 12'4")Master En-Suite1.93m x 1.89m (6'4" x 6'2")Bedroom Two4.43m x 3.53m (14'6" x 11'7")Bedroom Three3.61m x 3.53m (11'10" x 11'7")Bedroom Four3.09m x 1.94m (10'2" x 6'4")Bathroom3.44m x 1.94m (11'3" x 6'4")Annexe Living Room4.34m x 3.66m (14'3" x 12'0")Annexe Bedroom3.66m x 2.15m (12'0" x 7'1")

The property has been recently refurbished to a high standard and comprises a front reception, the hallway with wooden flooring that leads into a second reception room with double patio doors onto a pretty garden with rear access. listing.description: An absolutely stunning, vastly improved and extended, four bedroom two bathroom Victorian house with a landscaped 50ft south facing garden located just 0.75 miles from Woolwich Arsenal mainline Station, the DLR and future Crossrail.The property has been extensively refurbished by the current owners to a very high standard. Features include high ceilings, period fireplaces, stripped and waxed floor boards, double glazed windows and plantation shutters.Spanning in excess of 1,400 sq.Ft, the accommodation briefly comprises a large 24 ft. Dual through reception room with lounge and dinner areas and wood burner. To the rear there is a very attractive modern kitchen with island unit, polished white granite worktops, breakfast bar and integrated appliances. The kitchen communicates through double glazed folding doors with the garden. There are three bedrooms to the first floor including a very large 13'8 x 11'0 bedroom to the front with built-in wardrobes. The very attractive modern first floor bathroom is dressed with granite tiles, and contains separate shower and bath. The loft has been converted to provide a gorgeous master suite with very large bedroom, Juliette balcony to the rear, incredible views toward the river, City airport and Canary Wharf to the front, and a beautiful white marble ensuite bathroom.The current vendors have drastically improved the rear garden by undertaking the removal of a large section of earth at the back of the house. This has created a large terrace, ideal for summer outdoor dining/barbecue and children's play area. It has also helped to bring light into the kitchen and rear reception room. The garden then steps up to a large deck, lawn, flowerbeds and a large office shed with insulated roof, laminated flooring, fit-in desk and bookshelves, electricity, and phone and internet connections.The property is located in the heart of Shooters Hill. Being within the London Green Belt it enjoys fresh, clean air. The house is within short walking distance from Shooters Hill Golf Club and Oxleas Wood, one of the few remaining ancient forests. It is also only a few-minute drive from the Royal Observatory Greenwich.This is an impressive period home with a very stylish and modern feel that has become available due to unexpected relocation. Your immediate viewing is essential. Virtual tours can be seen at

When renting a property there are various fees to take into account.

A month's rent will be payable in advance as well as a damages deposit equivalent to a month and a half rent.

Additional fees include an administration fee of £240 incl. VAT; referencing fee of £51 incl. VAT for each tenant and guarantor (if required); plus an inventory check in fee typically £85-£150 depending on the size and type of property.

Once you've found a property you like you need to make an offer, you will be asked for an initial deposit (usually a nominal amount) to take the property off the market.

listing.short_description:
Imposing brick-fronted victorian terrace : A fantastic opportunity to renovate a charming Victorian property located within the Mini Holland scheme and close by Walthamstow Central and Lloyd Park. The Property This quirky Victorian house is in need of new owners with the vision to modernise in a way that will accentuate the building's inherent character. The garden to the rear is well proportioned for this style of property and is not overlooked. Bay windows, ornate plasterwork, chimney breasts and original timber floor-boards are some of the original features waiting to be brought back to life. An imaginative new owner may find ways of re-arranging and extending the accommodation to get the best out of it. The current layout is three first floor bedrooms, ground floor through lounge, ground floor kitchen room and a first floor bathroom. The Location Greenleaf Road is a residential street o.8 miles from Walthamstow Central Station, 0.9 miles from Walthamstow St James Street Station and 0.8 miles from Blackhorse Road Station. There are many local shops and public houses and coffee shops within a short walk. The M11, A406 and A12 roads are all easily accessible by car. Our View If you're looking for the character and charm offered by Victorian houses and are looking for a project property this could be the property for you.

listing.letting_fees:
Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Once you have found a property and your offer has been accepted by the landlord, we will require a Preliminary Payment (Holding Deposit)
Between £500.00-£1,000.00 (depending on the value of the property), deducted from your final completion monies.
Standard Fees
Administration fees
We handle all the paperwork and provide a tenancy agreement for you and your landlord to sign. The fee is based on the size of the property, the number of tenants and rental value:
• Up to £1,500.00 pcm:£600.00 per tenancy
• Up to £2,00.000 pcm: £660.00 per tenancy
• Over £2,000.00 pcm: £poa per tenancy
References
Includes an employer’s reference to confirm your income to rent ratio for affordability, a credit history check, confirmation of residency and a previous landlord’s reference (if applicable).
• £60.00 per person

Initial Move in Monies
All the initial move in monies and will need to be paid in cleared funds to us 3 days prior to move in.
Security Deposit
The deposit will be protected as part of the tenancy deposit regulations; we use the industry renowned my|deposits. 6 weeks rent prior to moving into the property, this will be refunded to you at the end of the tenancy minus any deductions, if applicable.
Inventory Check In procedure
A convenient time will be arranged for you to meet with the inventory clerk to formally check you into the property. Prices vary according to the size of the property.
• Studio: £125.00

Within 5 working days or less

Renewing a tenancy

Credit check at renewal
In some circumstances, it may be a pre agreed requirement for a new credit check to be obtained at the point of renewal.

Landlord references
If you decide to move on and require for us to provide you with a reference to your new agent or landlord.

Tenancy Swap Fees
Administration: Covering contract negotiation, amending terms, updating the tenancy agreement during the tenancy and immigration and visa confirmation.

Referencing: Referencing the new occupant, including identity, financial credit checks, obtaining references from current or previous employers / landlords and any other relevant information to assess affordability

Fees apply

Tenant Fees & Charges

Mandatory charges associated with the setting up of your tenancy

There are various fees and charges associated with renting a property that you should be aware of when considering making an offer on a property. More detailed information is available upon request.

(Where not payable you will be advised accordingly)

Preliminary Charge - 42% Inc. VAT of the first months rent or £420 Inc. VAT, whichever is the greater.
This charge all inclusive charge covers the tenancy agreement, referencing and the check-in. It is not collected until the landlord has, subject-to-contact and references, accepted your offer. If the tenancy does not proceed for whatever reason we will refund a proportionate amount of the charge based on work undertaken and costs incurred.

Short Let Fee – From £440 (Inc. VAT)†

This charge applies to short term lettings only and covers: The cost of preparing an Agreement; an inventory check-in and an end of tenancy clean (excluding carpets).

Other funds you should allow for

Payment of Intent – To be agreed with you

We may require a payment of intent as confirmation of your intent to proceed with the proposed tenancy. This will be put towards your first rental payment and will only be refunded if our client elects not to proceed. Payment of this sum does not constitute the granting of a tenancy.

Rent in Advance – 1 Month

You will usually be required to pay 1 months rent in advance.

Deposit – Equivalent to 6 weeks rent

The deposit is held to protect your landlord from you not meeting your obligations under the terms of the tenancy.

Stamp Duty Land Tax

This tax is payable on tenancies where the rent exceeds £125,000.

Charges if you terminate your tenancy Change of Sharer - £420 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you wish to replace a named tenant with another tenant part way through your tenancy and your landlord has agreed to the change. Please note that the replacement tenant will be charged separately for referencing in the sum of £54 Inc. VAT each.

Deed of Surrender - £75 Inc. VAT

This charge applies to preparation of documentation where, at your request, the landlord has agreed to release you from the tenancy early.

Charges if you renew your tenancy

Memorandum of Renewal - £90 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a basic document to confirm details of any renewal.

Renewal Tenancy Agreement - £150 Inc. VAT

This charge covers the cost of preparing a more extensive renewal document where changes to the terms agreed dictate.

Potential charges at the end of your tenancy

Future Landlord Reference - £30 Inc. VAT

This charge applies when you ask us to provide a reference to a future landlord.

† Based on a 2 bedroom property in London.
listing.description: This attractive 'Laing' built house has been fully renovated by the current owners and now offers a peaceful santurary to relax. Refurbishments include plastering thorughout, new electrics and plumbing including under floor heating in the ground floor living space.SituationStanmore is a leafy, tranquil suburb in North-West London situated between Edgware and Bushey. The last stop on the Jubilee line, a journey to Bond Street from Stanmore takes 31 minutes. As an area Stanmore boasts an abundance of greenery, charming commons and acres of Green Belt. It is one of North West London’s most desirable areas due to its boutique cafes, shopping facilities, and location to prominent state and private schools which include Haberdashers’ Aske’s, North London Collegiate, St. Margaret’s, and Stanmore College.OutsideTo the front a new block paved driveway has been expertly laid whilst the rear garden has been landscaped and offers a patio and area of lawn with a few mature trees.Additional InformationPlanning permission has been granted for a 6 meter full width rear extension. listing.description: Perfectly located on the edge of east and west Greenwich is this three bedroom modern house, built in the 1970's, which measures approximately 960 sq.F and has a large east facing garden.Whilst in reasonable condition it's worth noting that the property would definitely benefit from an update. Internal accommodation comprises a good sized lounge and kitchen breakfast room on the ground floor, along with a WC. Upstairs there are three bedrooms and a bathroom. Added benefits include a large loft and also separate storage. There is double glazing throughout and electric heating.As mentioned, the house is really well located and is just a few moments from the river, but also a short walk to the town centre and Royal Park. Greenwich town has a wonderful array of shops and restaurants, along with mainline rail, DLR and riverboat service. There is no chain.

listing.description: You will be pleasantly surprised when you step into this beautifully presented family home that has been extensively refurbished and thoughtfully extended to cater for today's informal style of living with a useful guest cloakroom and a large open plan kitchen/diner/family room across the rear. This is a lovely light and airy room, with bi-fold doors opening onto the garden and a large roof lantern that floods the room with natural light. The kitchen area has been beautifully appointed with a range of contemporary style units with contrasting granite work surfaces including a large central island. There is a comprehensive range of integrated appliances including an induction hob with a stainless steel cooker hood over, double oven, fridge/freezer, washing machine and dishwasher. To the rear there is ample space for a large dining table and sofa. To the front is the elegant southerly facing living room that makes a quiet retreat away from the family and retains its open fireplace fitted with a limestone surround and gas/coal effect fire creating a focal point to the room. To the first floor are three bedrooms, the two principal double rooms having built-in wardrobes. Completing the accommodation is the attractively refitted bathroom with a modern 4 piece white suite including a separate shower cubicle. Council Tax Band: E

listing.description: This traditional 1930's double fronted detached bungalow offers generously proportioned accommodation. The property is in a clean and tidy condition yet is dated in its fitment and provides excellent potential for extension and refurbishment, which has been taken into consideration within the asking price. A useful entrance porch opens into a large hallway that sets the scene. The spacious living room is a lovely room retaining its attractive open inglenook fireplace inset with two stained glass windows; to the rear, a casement door opens onto the rear garden. Adjoining is the kitchen/breakfast room that also overlooks the garden; it has been fitted to a basic standard and includes the usual appliances. To the front are 2 double bay fronted bedrooms, the main having a wide double-glazed bay window and ample space for freestanding furniture. The 3rd bedroom is a good-sized single with a range of wall-to-wall mirror fronted built-in wardrobes. Completing the accommodation is the bathroom and separate WC are fitted with a matching pastel coloured 3-piece suite. Council Tax: Band E
listing.short_description: A traditional 3 bedroom detached bungalow with a lovely homely atmosphere and retaining much of its original character. Today it would benefit from modernisation and offers excellent potential to extend (subject to the usual planning consents). Set in large mature gardens within one of Lower Sunbury's premier crescents, only half a mile from the village centre and reputable schools. EPC Rating: D
